subtitle: Oracle Scholars Internship
title: Live Sentiment Analysis
description:
My team showcased the power of Oracle Cloud to a fintech bank's CEO for our summer 2019 internship at Oracle in Reston, VA.

Our product presented the CEO with actionable insights for increasing revenue by cross-selling bank services, live brand management, and recommendations for future product placement or relocation. My team calculated these insights by synergizing seven unique data sources using Oracle Cloud's powerful autonomous database.

For our product I created a tool for real-time brand management. This tool uses live data from Twitter and news websites and harnesses a large amount of fast-moving data to give you perspective on how people feel about any topic of your choice. Now the impact of any product announcement, earnings report, or press release can be measured and addressed by the appropriate faculty.

My software continuously gathered Tweets and news articles, and within a couple of days, it had collected a few hundred thousand data points. At this point, I discovered Oracle Analytics Cloud's sentiment analysis was not optimized for analyzing a large volume of data and was not suitable for live events such as stock trading or a product release. In order to analyze and visualize data on-the-fly, I created my own algorithm to categorize tweets and label them as positive, neutral, or negative.

Using my data and six other internal and external sources, we created dashboards, generated insight reports, and made a targeted recommendation.

Our product demonstrated the capabilities of Oracle Autonomous Database by consolidating data across many systems. With this data, we used tools such as Oracle Analytics Cloud for intuitive data visualizations. Overall, we created four dashboards analyzing revenue sources, public brand perception, the customer, and profitability.

At the end of the internship, we presented our work to the office, including our manager and mentor. Our colleagues were interested in my sentiment analysis algorithm and how I was able to integrate my own software into the Oracle Cloud ecosystem of products. I learned from my manager to sell my work by emphasizing the value it provides to the customer. My mentor taught me to frame our pitch and demo toward a persona, which for us was the CEO of a fintech bank.

My favorite memory from this internship was a tubing trip down the Potomac river. I am thankful for the opportunity to work at a top software company where I met many talented people.
